availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin F. Miller (Grant County, Kentucky, soldier)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Resident of Grant County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Grant County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 22, 1862 to January 1864. Captured at Roane County, Tennessee on October 20, 1863. Prisoner of war from October 20, 1863 to March 6, 1864. Died in Richmond, Virginia, while a prisoner of war on March 6, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 308B-309A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, 822 County, p. 822.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0110.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 278-9.
